overview_of_class: There is little agreement on what precisely constitutes data science, but most agree that data science is highly interdisciplinary and that at its core involves the application of knowledge and skills from both statistics and computer science. Therefore, the main objective of this course will be to cultivate and accumulate necessary data analytic skills (e.g. coding in R and/or python) and knowledge. Students will develop skills to effectively collect, manage, manipulate, and analyze data. We will develop these skills through project/lab based learning which will require the use of R and/or python (1-2 projects/labs per week). We will also build introductory knowledge of supervised machine learning (i.e. regression and classification methods).

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: At least a basic understanding of statistics is necessary (i.e. STAT 202 or 210). Some basic familiarity with R and/or python is desirable, but not entirely necessary as long as an effort is made to learn some basic R and/or python outside of class. Students should be prepared to spend approximately 7 to 12 hours outside of class working on this course - dependent on knowledge of R and/or python.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value:
General Course Structure:
A typical class will devote 10-20 minutes to discussion/lecture with the remaining time devoted to projects/labs where students will either work by themselves or in groups. Students will be expected to present/share work from these activities either through canvas or during class. There will be a final project in place of a final exam.
